oai_dc:dc.dc:description: ||kunnu and other old men dream of rain, which speedily comes. (L VIII.-23. 8005-8010). One of the rainmakers calls to the rain, addressing it, and asks that it may fall gently and not angrily (as the old men have dreamt). 1) p.8004v: |han=kass'o heard this story from his mother (|xabbi-an); the name of one of the old men who dream, 2) p.8007v: the channel used for the running rain water, 3) p.8008v: what the old men say to the rain so that it may fall gently, 4) This story is found in Book VIII-23.
